ECKeyPair

public ECKeyPair(ECPrivateKey privateKey,
                 ECPublicKey publicKey)
          throws CryptoUtilsException
ECKeyPair constructor, which receives both public and privateKeys

Parameters:
privateKey - Private part of the key
publicKey - Public part of the key
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the fields of the keys and points are not the same

ECKeyPair

public ECKeyPair(ECDomainParameters parameters,
                 java.math.BigInteger privateKeyPart,
                 ECPointFp publicKeyPoint)
          throws CryptoUtilsException
Constructor that receives each parameter for construct the key over Fp

Parameters:
parameters - Curve parameters
privateKeyPart - Private part of the key (BigInter)
publicKeyPoint - Point that represents the public part of the key
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the point and the parameters does not correspond to the same field

parse

public static ECKeyPair parse(org.spongycastle.crypto.AsymmetricCipherKeyPair keyPair)
                       throws CryptoUtilsException
Parse SpongyCastle AsymmetricCipherKeyPair to EC Key Pair, the result of the parse will returned

Parameters:
keyPair - EC Key Pair to be parsed
Returns:
The new ECKeyPair resulting of the parse
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if the key pair does not correspond to valid EC Keys parameters

parseTo

public org.spongycastle.crypto.AsymmetricCipherKeyPair parseTo()
Parse the calling object to SpongyCastle AsymmetricCipherKeyPair representation

Returns:
New AsymmetricCipherKeyPair object with the key values of the current object

savePKCS12

public void savePKCS12(java.lang.String fileName,
                       java.lang.String keyStorePwd,
                       java.lang.String privKeyPwd,
                       java.security.cert.Certificate[] chain)
                throws CryptoUtilsException
Creates a new PKCS12 file, in which is stored the EC Private key protected by PBE and the certificate chain for the corresponding public key

Parameters:
fileName - File name for the pkcs12 file (commonly with extension .p12)
keyStorePwd - Password for the pkcs12 file
privKeyPwd - File for the encrypting the private key
chain - Certificate Chain, must include at least one, containing the subject public key
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException

loadPKCS12

public static java.lang.Object[] loadPKCS12(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            java.lang.String keyStorePwd,
                                            java.lang.String privKeyPwd)
                                     throws CryptoUtilsException
Loads the EC Key Pair stored in a pkcs12

Parameters:
fileName - File in which are stored the keys
keyStorePwd - PKCS12 File password
privKeyPwd - PrivateKey Password
Returns:
An object array with 2 positions, in the first one the ECKeyPair stored in the pkcs12 file and in the second one the certificate chain stored in the pkcs12 file
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException

encodePKCS12

public byte[] encodePKCS12(java.lang.String keyStorePwd,
                           java.lang.String privKeyPwd,
                           java.security.cert.Certificate[] chain)
                    throws CryptoUtilsException
Encode the ECKeyPair as a PKCS12 byte array using base64, in which is stored the EC Private key protected by PBE and the certificate chain for the corresponding public key

Parameters:
keyStorePwd - Password for the pkcs12 file
privKeyPwd - File for the encrypting the private key
chain - Certificate Chain, must include at least one, containing the subject public key
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException

decodePKCS12

public static java.lang.Object[] decodePKCS12(byte[] pairBytes,
                                              java.lang.String keyStorePwd,
                                              java.lang.String privKeyPwd)
                                       throws CryptoUtilsException
Decodes a PKCS12 byte array encoded using base64 to an ECKeyPair object

Parameters:
pairBytes - byte array encoded using base64 which represents the RSAKeyPair
keyStorePwd - PKCS12 File password
privKeyPwd - PrivateKey Password
Returns:
An object array with 2 positions, in the first one the ECKeyPair stored in the pkcs12 file and in the second one the certificate chain stored in the pkcs12 file
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException
